tn.ref: Then it happened
tn.text: This phrase is used here to mark the beginning of a new part of the story. If your language has a way for doing this, you could consider using it here.

tn.ref: in the twelfth month ... on the first of the month
tn.text: This is the twelfth and final month of the Hebrew calendar. The first day is near the end of February. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: of the twelfth year
tn.text: AT: "of the twelfth year of the exile of King Jehoiachin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: the word of Yahweh came
tn.text: "Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Son of man
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:02:01|2:3]].

tn.ref: You are like a young lion ... like a monster in the seas
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) He thought he was like a lion, but he was really only a monster, or 2) he was like a lion and a monster.

tn.ref: like a young lion among the nations
tn.text: Egypt was stronger than other nations, like lions are stronger than other animals. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: like a monster in the seas
tn.text: Pharaoh was powerful but he only caused trouble for others, like this description of a monster in the water. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: monster
tn.text: A monster is an animal that is big and dangerous. This one might be a crocodile. See how you translated this word in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:29:01|29:3]].

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh continues to speak to Pharaoh and to compare him to a monster that lives in the water.

tn.ref: The Lord Yahweh says this
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:05|5:5]].

tn.ref: So I will spread my net over you in the assembly of many peoples
tn.text: AT: "So I will gather many peoples and throw my net over you." ([[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: they will lift you up in my net
tn.text: AT: "using my net, the peoples will pull you up out of the water" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: I will abandon you in the land
tn.text: "I will leave you helpless on the land." The monster that was scary when it was in the water cannot do anything when it is left on dry land.

tn.ref: all the birds of the heavens
tn.text: "all the birds that fly in the sky"

tn.ref: the hunger of all living animals on earth will be satisfied by you
tn.text: AT: "I will let all the animals of the earth eat your body until they are not hungry anymore" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh continues to speak to Pharaoh and to compare him to a monster that lives in the water.

tn.ref: your worm filled corpse
tn.text: "your rotting body"

tn.ref: Then I will pour your blood over the mountains
tn.text: AT: "I will flood the land with your blood all the way to the mountains."

tn.ref: the stream beds will be filled with your blood
tn.text: AT: "I will fill the streams with your blood" or "and they will fill the streams with your blood" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh continues telling Pharaoh what he will do to Egypt.

tn.ref: Then when I put out your lamp
tn.text: "when I snuff out your flame." Yahweh compares the way he will destroy Pharaoh to the way he would put out the flame of a lamp. AT: "When I destroy you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I will cover the heavens
tn.text: Yahweh will cover the sky so that people on earth cannot see the light of the stars, sun and moon.

tn.ref: darken its stars
tn.text: "I will make the stars dark." They will have no light.

tn.ref: I will put darkness over your land
tn.text: "I will make it dark in your land"

tn.ref: this is the Lord Yahweh's declaration
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:11|5:11]].

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh continues to speak to Pharaoh.

tn.ref: I will terrify the heart of many peoples
tn.text: AT: "I will make the hearts of many peoples afraid" or "I will cause many people to be terrified"

tn.ref: in lands that you do not know
tn.text: The way that Yahweh destroys Egypt will be so scary that even people in lands that Pharaoh never knew about will hear about it.

tn.ref: when I bring about your collapse among the nations
tn.text: AT: "when nations hear about the way I destroyed you"

tn.ref: I will shock many peoples concerning you
tn.text: "I will make many peoples horrified because of what happens to you"

tn.ref: their kings will shudder in horror concerning you
tn.text: AT: "their kings will be so scared about what happens to you that they will shake"

tn.ref: Every moment each one will tremble because of you
tn.text: AT: "Every one of them will keep shaking because of their fear"

tn.ref: on the day of your downfall
tn.text: AT: "when I destroy you"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh continues to speak to Pharaoh.

tn.ref: The sword of the king of Babylon will come against you
tn.text: The word "sword" refers here to an army. AT: "The army of the king of Babylon will attack you"

tn.ref: I will cause your servants to fall by warriors' swords
tn.text: AT: "I will cause your people to fall because of the swords of mighty men"

tn.ref: each warrior a terror of nations
tn.text: AT: "Each warrior terrifies the nations" or "each one of them makes the nations afraid"

tn.ref: and destroy all of its multitudes
tn.text: "and kill the very large number of people that live in Egypt"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh continues speaking.

tn.ref: all the livestock
tn.text: Livestock are animals that people have to eat and for other reasons. Cows, sheep, and goats are all livestock.

tn.ref: from beside the plentiful waters
tn.text: "from the places where there is a lot of water"

tn.ref: the foot of man
tn.text: "the feet of people"

tn.ref: Then I will calm their waters
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "I will make the water calm" or 2) "I will make the water clear." When no one stirs up the water, the dirt settles down and the water becomes clear.

tn.ref: make their rivers run like oil
tn.text: Oil flows slowly and smoothly. AT: "make the rivers run smoothly like oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: this is the Lord Yahweh's declaration
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:11|5:11]].

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh continues speaking.

tn.ref: a land that was full
tn.text: AT: "a land that was full of living creatures" or "a land that was full of life"

tn.ref: when I attack all of her inhabitants
tn.text: "when I destroy all who live there"

tn.ref: know that I am Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:06|6:7]].

tn.ref: There will be a lament
tn.text: AT: "This is the song of mourning that people will sing"

tn.ref: the daughters of the nations
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "the women of other nations" or "people of other nations"

tn.ref: will lament over her
tn.text: The word "her" refers to the country of Egypt.

tn.ref: this is the Lord Yahweh's declaration
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:11|5:11]].

tn.ref: Then it happened
tn.text: This phrase is used here to mark the beginning of a new message. If your language has a way for doing this, you could consider using it here.

tn.ref: in the twelfth year
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) This happened in the twelfth year after the Babylonians took the Israelites to Babylon or 2) this happened in twelfth year after the Babylonians took Jehoiachin to Babylon. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: the word of Yahweh came
tn.text: "Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Son of man
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:02:01|2:3]].

tn.ref: weep for the servants of Egypt
tn.text: "cry loudly for the army of Egypt"

tn.ref: throw them down—her and the daughters of majestic nations
tn.text: AT: "throw Egypt and the daughters of majestic nations down"

tn.ref: the daughters of majestic nations
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "the people of powerful nations" or 2) "other powerful nations."

tn.ref: the lowest earth
tn.text: "to the places under the ground." When people died, they were put in the ground. So, "throw them down ... to the lowest earth" means "make them die." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: with those who have gone down to the pit!
tn.text: "with everyone else who had died and gone into the ground"

tn.ref: the pit
tn.text: "the pit" refers to the grave. It is the hole in the ground that people go into after they have died.

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh continues speaking to Ezekiel.

tn.ref: Ask them
tn.text: "Ask Egypt and her army"

tn.ref: Go down
tn.text: It is implied that they go down to Sheol. AT: "Go down to Sheol." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: They
tn.text: "Egypt and her army"

tn.ref: will fall
tn.text: "will die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: who were killed by the sword
tn.text: AT: "whom enemies killed with swords" or "who died in battle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Egypt is given to the sword
tn.text: AT: "Enemies will attack Egypt"

tn.ref: her enemies will seize her and her servants
tn.text: "Her enemies will drag off Egypt and her servants."

tn.ref: her servants
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) Egypt's people or 2) Egypt's army.

tn.ref: about Egypt and her allies
tn.text: AT: "about the Egyptians and those who join them"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh continues speaking to Ezekiel about nations in Sheol. Because what God is showing Ezekiel may be for future time, either the present tense (as in the ULB), or the future tense (as in the UDB) is suitable for these verses and the following verses.

tn.ref: Assyria is there with all her assembly
tn.text: AT: "The people of Assyria and all her army are there in Sheol" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: all of them were killed by the sword
tn.text: AT: "all of them died by the sword" or "all of them had died in battle." See how you translated "who had been killed by the sword" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:31:17|31:17]].

tn.ref: are set in the recesses of the pit
tn.text: "are in the deepest part of the pit"

tn.ref: all of those who were killed, who fell by the sword
tn.text: AT: "all those whom enemies killed with swords" or "all those who died when enemies killed them in battle (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: those who brought terror on the land of the living
tn.text: "those who had caused people in the land of the living to be very afraid." AT: "those who, when they were still alive, caused people to be extremely afraid"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh continues speaking to Ezekiel about nations in Sheol.

tn.ref: Elam is there
tn.text: Here "Elam" refers to the people of that country. AT: "The people of Elam are also there in Sheol" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: her servants
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) her many people or 2) her army.

tn.ref: Her graves surround her
tn.text: See how you translated "Her graves surround her" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:32:22|32:22]].

tn.ref: all of them were killed
tn.text: AT: "Her enemies killed them all"

tn.ref: Those who fell by the sword
tn.text: "who fell by the sword" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:32:22|32:23]].

tn.ref: who have gone down uncircumcised
tn.text: "who were uncircumcised when they went down"

tn.ref: to the lowest parts of the earth
tn.text: "to places deep down in the ground" or "to the land deep down in the ground." See how you translated "in the lowest realms of the earth" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:26:19|26:20]].

tn.ref: who brought their terrors on the land of the living
tn.text: See how you translated "brought terror on the land of the living" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:32:22|32:23]].

tn.ref: who now carry their own shame with them
tn.text: "who feel ashamed" or "who are now disgraced"

tn.ref: They set a bedroll for Elam and all her servants
tn.text: "They gave beds to Elam and all her servants."

tn.ref: in the midst of the slain
tn.text: "with all the other people who were killed."

tn.ref: All of them are uncircumcised
tn.text: The Egyptians hated people who were not circumcised. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: Elam is among all those who were killed
tn.text: This is very similar to the first part of the verse. AT: "The dead people gave Elam a place to lie among themselves"

tn.ref: Connecting Statement:
tn.text: Yahweh continues speaking to Ezekiel about nations in Sheol.

tn.ref: all their servants
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "all their army" or 2) "all their many people."

tn.ref: Their graves surround them
tn.text: See how you translated "her graves around her" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:32:22|32:22]].

tn.ref: All of them ... land of the living
tn.text: See how you translated "All of them ... land of the living" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:32:24|32:25]].

tn.ref: their shields placed over their bones
tn.text: Unlike the other uncircumcised, the Meshech and Tubal people were given proper burials. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: For they were the terror of warriors in the land of the living
tn.text: "because, while they were still alive, they made warriors very afraid"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh continues speaking.

tn.ref: will be destroyed
tn.text: AT: "I will destroy you." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: in the midst of the uncircumcised
tn.text: AT: "along with uncircumcised people"

tn.ref: those killed by the sword
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:32:24|32:25]].

tn.ref: Edom is there with her kings and all her leaders
tn.text: "Edom is in Sheol with her kings and all her leaders." AT: "the people of Edom are in Sheol with their kings and all their leaders."

tn.ref: They were powerful
tn.text: "They had a lot of power"

tn.ref: The princes of the north
tn.text: "The princes who ruled nations in the north"

tn.ref: are there
tn.text: "are in Sheol"

tn.ref: went down
tn.text: "went down to Sheol"

tn.ref: with the dead
tn.text: "with those who were killed"

tn.ref: who were killed by the sword
tn.text: See how you translated "who had been killed by the sword" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:31:17|31:17]].

tn.ref: They carry their own shame, together with the others who are going down to the pit
tn.text: See how you translated "they carry their own shame with them, together with the ones going down to the pit" [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:32:24|32:25]].

tn.ref: Pharaoh will look
tn.text: AT: "Pharaoh will see all the dead people from other nations." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: and be comforted about all his servants
tn.text: It is implied that Pharaoh will be comforted because the armies of other great kings also died. AT "and will comfort himself that he was not the only king whose entire army died." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: who were killed by the sword
tn.text: See how you translated "who had been killed by the sword" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:31:17|31:17]].

tn.ref: this is the Lord Yahweh's declaration
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:11|5:11]].

tn.ref: I made him cause terror in the land of the living
tn.text: AT: "While Pharaoh was still alive, I allowed him to terrify people"

tn.ref: he will lie down in the midst of the uncircumcised
tn.text: Here "lie down" refers to his body being place in the grave when he dies. AT: "his dead body will be buried with those who are not circumcised"
